action.action-desc: Mr. Latta introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Energy to prepare periodic assessments and submit reports on the supply chain for the generation and transmission of electricity, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Electric Supply Chain Act.

section.header: Assessment and report on the supply chain for the generation and transmission of electricity

subsection.text: In carrying out the requirements of the Department of Energy Organization Act (42 U.S.C. 7101 et seq.), the Secretary shall, for purposes of monitoring the supply chain for the generation and transmission of electricity and in consultation with relevant stakeholders, prepare periodic assessments on such supply chain that—

subparagraph.text: efforts and opportunities to strengthen, secure, and expand such supply chain;

any trends, risks, and vulnerabilities in the supply, demand, and availability of components for or related to generating or transmitting electricity, including components that are necessary for the construction or deployment of facilities that generate or transmit electricity;
national security and energy security considerations for strengthening, securing, and expanding such supply chain;
barriers to expanding the capacity to—

clause.text: manufacture components for or related to generating or transmitting electricity in the United States; and
process critical materials in the United States;

subparagraph.text: domestic policies that deter or otherwise inhibit greater investment into such supply chain;
the effects of any reliance of the United States on any foreign entity of concern for—

clause.text: components for or related to generating or transmitting electricity; and
the exploration, development, or production of critical materials necessary for manufacturing such components; and

subparagraph.text: workforce challenges affecting such supply chain;

paragraph.text: identify emerging issues in such supply chain; and

subparagraph.text: address any emerging issues identified under paragraph (2); and
secure and expand such supply chain.

subsection.text: Not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act, and periodically thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the most recent assessment prepared under subsection (a).

paragraph.text: The term appropriate committees of Congress means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate.

paragraph.text: The term critical material has the meaning given such term in section 7002(a) of the Energy Act of 2020 (30 U.S.C. 1606(a)).
The term Electric Reliability Organization has the meaning given such term in section 215(a) of the Federal Power Act (42 U.S.C. 824o(a)).
The term electric utility has the meaning given such term in section 3 of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 796).
The term foreign entity of concern has the meaning given such term in section 40207(a) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (42 U.S.C. 18741(a)).

subparagraph.text: means a stakeholder that is involved in—

clause.text: the generation, storage, transmission, or distribution of electricity; or
the supply chain for such generation, storage, transmission, or distribution; and

subparagraph.text: includes an electric utility, an electric grid component manufacturer, a person who constructs an electric generating facility, an electric power system cybersecurity expert, the Electric Reliability Organization, a ratepayer advocacy stakeholder, and any other related private sector stakeholder.

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of Energy.
